entries.text: This character's background What winding paths brought them here
The keepsake held by this character Each a reflection of its owner
A cumulative figure that represents overall attribute strength. You can level up using runes.
Total runes in possession. Upon dying, you will drop any runes in your possession at the site of your death.
Number of runes required to raise a level. When you level up, you can choose an attribute to increase.
The number of Great Runes in your possession
Attribute governing HP. Also affects fire resistance and immunity.
Attribute governing stamina. Also affects robustness. This attribute also determines how heavy your equipment can be.
Attribute that determines FP. Also affects focus.
Attribute required to wield heavy armaments. Also boosts attack power of strength-scaling armaments and affects your physical defense.

Attribute required to wield advanced armaments. Also boosts attack power of dexterity-scaling armaments, reduces casting time of spells, softens fall damage, and makes it harder to be knocked off your horse.
Attribute required to perform glintstone sorceries. Also boosts magic power of intelligence-scaling sorceries and improves magic resistance.
Attribute required to perform sacred incantations. Also boosts magic power of faith-scaling incantations.
Attribute governing discovery. Also affects holy defense, vitality, and certain sorceries and incantations.
Your life. If reduced to nothing, you die. Replenish it by drinking from the Flask of Crimson Tears or resting at a site of grace.
Energy consumed to use spells and skills. Replenish it by drinking from the Flask of Cerulean Tears or resting at a site of grace.
Required for various actions. Depletes when certain actions are taken, but recovers automatically.
Total weight of equipped armaments and armor. Movement slows as load increases. The rightmost number is the maximum weight that can be equipped; exceed it and movement slows dramatically.
Max weight of equippable armaments and armor. Movement slows as load increases. Exceed this number and movement slows dramatically.
Attack power of the armament equipped in right hand slot 1
Attack power of the armament equipped in right hand slot 2
Attack power of the armament equipped in right hand slot 3
Attack power of the armament equipped in left hand slot 1
Attack power of the armament equipped in left hand slot 2
Attack power of the armament equipped in left hand slot 3
The body's capacity to endure standard physical damage
The body's capacity to endure striking physical damage
The body's capacity to endure slashing physical damage
The body's capacity to endure piercing physical damage
The body's capacity to endure magical damage
The body's capacity to endure fire damage
The body's capacity to endure lightning damage
The body's capacity to endure holy damage
The body's capacity to resist various poisons and rot. Higher values make it more difficult to succumb to these ailments.
The body's capacity to resist blood loss and frostbite. Higher values make it more difficult to succumb to these ailments.
The body's capacity to resist sleep and bouts of madness. Higher values make it more difficult to succumb to these ailments.
The body's capacity to resist death. Higher values make it more difficult to be afflicted with instant death.
The number of slots available for memorizing sorceries and incantations
Governs likelihood of finding items on the corpses of defeated foes
The degree to which you can resist collapsing under enemy attacks
Your defense power and damage negation against standard physical attacks. The former is calculated via attributes, while the latter is calculated via defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your defense power and damage negation against striking physical attacks. The former is calculated via attributes, while the latter is calculated via defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your defense power and damage negation against slashing physical attacks. The former is calculated via attributes, while the latter is calculated via defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your defense power and damage negation against piercing physical attacks. The former is calculated via attributes, while the latter is calculated via defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your defense power and damage negation against magical attacks. The former is calculated via attributes, while the latter is calculated via defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your defense power and damage negation against fire attacks. The former is calculated via attributes, while the latter is calculated via defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your defense power and damage negation against lightning attacks. The former is calculated via attributes, while the latter is calculated via defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your defense power and damage negation against holy attacks. The former is calculated via attributes, while the latter is calculated via defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your resistance to various poisons and rot. The higher the number, the lower your susceptibility. Governed by your attributes, as well as defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your resistance to blood loss and frostbite. The higher the number, the lower your susceptibility. Governed by your attributes, as well as defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your resistance to sleep and bouts of madness. The higher the number, the lower your susceptibility. Governed by your attributes, as well as defensive gear and any additional effects.
Your resistance to death. The higher the number, the lower your susceptibility to instant death. Governed by your attributes, as well as defensive gear and any additional effects.
Armament category. Armaments belonging to the same category exhibit similar properties.
The types of physical damage dealt by this armament. Other than standard physical damage, striking, slashing, and piercing damage can also be dealt.
Number of this item currently held. The rightmost number indicates the maximum you may hold at one time.
Number of this item currently stored in chest. The rightmost number indicates the maximum you may hold at one time.
The names of skills you can use. Using most skills consumes FP.

Container items, essential to crafting, come in various forms, such as cracked pots and perfume bottles. The left number indicates how many containers are currently in use. The right number indicates how many you possess.
Number of containers remaining to use in crafting
The degree to which physical damage is negated while guarding
The degree to which magic damage is negated while guarding
The degree to which fire damage is negated while guarding
The degree to which lightning damage is negated while guarding
The degree to which holy damage is negated while guarding
The strength of critical hits, which can be performed on enemies you have got behind or stance-broken.
The stability of character's defense. The higher this value, the smaller the amount of stamina consumed when guarding attacks.
The amount of FP required to perform this skill
The degree to which sorceries increase in power
The degree to which incantations increase in power
The number of slots needed to memorize sorceries and incantations
The amount of FP required to cast this spell
The amount of FP required to use this item
The amount of HP required to use this item
The degree to which incoming standard physical damage is negated
The degree to which incoming striking physical damage is negated
The degree to which incoming slashing physical damage is negated
The degree to which incoming piercing physical damage is negated
The degree to which incoming magic damage is negated
The degree to which incoming fire damage is negated
The degree to which incoming lightning damage is negated
The degree to which incoming holy damage is negated
The resistance your armor offers to various poisons and rot. Higher values make it more difficult to succumb to these ailments.
The resistance your armor offers to blood loss and frostbite. Higher values make it more difficult to succumb to these ailments.
The resistance your armor offers to sleep and bouts of madness. Higher values make it more difficult to succumb to these ailments.
The resistance your armor offers to death. Higher values make it more difficult to be afflicted with instant death.
The degree to which you can resist collapsing under enemy attacks
Strength required to master this armament. Without sufficient strength, this armament's damage is greatly reduced.
Dexterity required to master this armament. Without sufficient dexterity, this armament's damage is greatly reduced.
Intelligence required to master this armament. Without sufficient intelligence, this armament's damage is greatly reduced.
Faith required to master this armament. Without sufficient faith, this armament's damage is greatly reduced.
Arcane required to master this armament. Without sufficient arcane, this armament's damage is greatly reduced.
Intelligence required to cast this sorcery or incantation. Without sufficient intelligence, it cannot be used.
Faith required to cast this sorcery or incantation. Without sufficient faith, it cannot be used.
Arcane required to cast this sorcery or incantation. Without sufficient arcane, it cannot be used.
The degree to which this armament's attacks scale with strength
The degree to which this armament's attacks scale with dexterity
The degree to which this armament's attacks scale with intelligence
The degree to which this armament's attacks scale with faith
The degree to which this armament's power or passive effects scale with strength
The degree to which this armament's power or passive effects scale with dexterity
The degree to which this armament's power or passive effects scale with intelligence
The degree to which this armament's power or passive effects scale with faith
The degree to which this armament's power or passive effects scale with arcane
The degree to which this armament's attacks scale with arcane
Type of item. Shows whether or not it will be consumed with use.
Skill granted by these Ashes of War
Armament types that these Ashes of War can alter
Affinity that these Ashes of War can grant. This can be expanded with whetblades.
Number of runes required to buy
Number of runes required to upgrade
Number of runes required to grant
Number of runes required to receive power from remembrances
Number of runes gained when sold
Usable on swords, axes, and hammers (small armaments and thrusting swords excepted)
Usable on medium and large armaments capable of thrusting
Usable on swords, axes, and polearms (colossal weapons excepted)
Usable on swords, axes, and hammers (small and medium swords excepted)
Usable on armaments capable of thrusting (colossal weapons excepted)
Usable on axes and hammers, as well as curved swords, greatswords, and reapers (colossal weapons excepted)
Usable on swords and polearms capable of slashing (colossal weapons excepted)
Usable on large and colossal axes and hammers
Usable on large and colossal weapons capable of thrusting, spears, and twinblades
Usable on small and medium swords (twinblades excepted)
Usable on small and medium swords, axes, and hammers, as well as polearms and staves (great spears excepted)
Usable on polearms capable of thrusting, heavy thrusting swords, and twinblades
Usable on swords capable of slashing, axes, hammers, and polearms (small and colossal weapons excepted)
Usable on swords, axes, and polearms capable of slashing (colossal weapons and great spears excepted)
Usable on polearms capable of thrusting and twinblades
Usable on melee armaments (small armaments and whips excepted)
Usable on swords (colossal weapons and twinblades excepted)
Usable on swords, axes, and hammers
Usable on swords and axes (small and colossal axes excepted)
Usable on small and medium swords
Usable on polearms and twinblades (great spears excepted)
Usable on small melee armaments and curved swords
Usable on small and medium shields
Usable on light bows and longbows
Usable on greataxes, warhammers, and colossal weapons
Usable on small and medium straight swords and thrusting swords
Usable on swords as well as polearms capable of thrusting (colossal weapons excepted)
Usable on large and colossal swords, axes, and hammers
Usable on melee armaments (daggers, thrusting swords, and whips excepted)
Usable on axes and hammers as well as curved swords and greatswords (colossal weapons excepted)
Usable on melee armaments (whips, fists, and claws excepted)
Usable on melee armaments (colossal weapons and whips excepted)
Usable on swords as well as polearms capable of thrusting (small and colossal weapons excepted)
Usable on daggers, curved swords, thrusting swords, fists, claws, and small and medium shields
Adjust brightness until the image on the right is barely visible
Adjust TV brightness to the highest setting

If you set a multiplayer password, you'll only be matched with other players using the same password for most multiplayer features.
However, multiplayer passwords do not apply to invasion or support multiplayer.

If you set a group password, you'll be more likely to see messages, summon signs, bloodstains, phantoms, and so on from others using the same password.
Elements given this special priority will appear differently from others.

With a Furlcalling Finger Remedy, you can see summon signs, which can be used to summon players from other worlds. (Finger Remedies are consumed with use.)
There are various types of summon signs. Gold signs summon Furled Finger cooperators. Red signs summon duelist adversaries. (For either type of multiplayer, the summoning player becomes Host of Fingers.)

With a Furlcalling Finger Remedy, you can see summon signs, which can be used to summon players from other worlds. (Finger Remedies are consumed with use.)
There are various types of summon signs. Gold signs summon Furled Finger cooperators. Red signs summon duelist adversaries. (For either type of multiplayer, the summoning player becomes Host of Fingers.)

You can leave a gold summon sign to play cooperative multiplayer.
This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a Furled Finger for cooperative multiplayer. Multiplayer begins once you are summoned. (Your objective will be to defeat the area boss.)
If you leave a second summon sign, the older sign will vanish.

You can leave a gold summon sign to play cooperative multiplayer.
This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a Furled Finger for cooperative multiplayer. Multiplayer begins once you are summoned. (Your objective will be to defeat the area boss.)
If you leave a second summon sign, the older sign will vanish.

You can leave a red summon sign to play competitive multiplayer.
This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a duelist adversary for competitive multiplayer. Multiplayer begins once you are summoned. (Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)
If you leave a second summon sign, the older sign will vanish.

You can leave a red summon sign to play competitive multiplayer.
This sign will appear in other players' worlds and allow them to summon you as a duelist adversary for competitive multiplayer. Multiplayer begins once you are summoned. (Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)
If you leave a second summon sign, the older sign will vanish.

Attempt to invade another player's world as a Bloody Finger.
If you successfully invade, invasion multiplayer will begin. (Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)
You can attempt another invasion of the same world by using a Phantom Finger item. (These items are consumed upon use.)

Choose a summoned player to send back to their own world.
This player will be removed from the multiplayer session.
Removed from multiplayer session. Returning to own world.

Lures in invaders.
This allows your world to be invaded without any Furled Finger cooperators present, and it also shortens the interval between windows of opportunity for invasion.
Additionally, enables the arrival of a second invader to join when a cooperator is present. (With two invaders, the maximum number of cooperators becomes one.)
Stop beckoning invaders to your world

Puts you into a ready state to answer, should someone in another world call for rescue. You will be summoned to their world as a hunter.
Multiplayer will begin once you are summoned. (Your objective will be to defeat invaders.)

Allows you to automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded.
You can also use this after being invaded to summon a hunter for help. (Summoning rescuers may not always be possible.)

Send a cooperative summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only).
If you are summoned, you will be transported to that summoning pool's location in the host player's world and multiplayer will begin. (Your objective will be to help the host player defeat the area boss.)
Remove co-op summon sign from summoning pool

Send a competitive summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only).
If you are summoned, you will be transported to that summoning pool's location in the host player's world and multiplayer will begin. (Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)
Remove hostile summon sign from summoning pool

Attempt to invade another player's world as a Bloody Finger.
If you successfully invade, your Festering Bloody Finger will be spent and invasion multiplayer will begin. (Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)
You can attempt another invasion of the same world by using a Phantom Finger item. (These items are consumed upon use.)

Attempt to invade another player's world as a recusant.
If you successfully invade, invasion multiplayer will begin. (Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers.)
You can attempt another invasion of the same world by using a Phantom Finger item. (These items are consumed upon use.)
